"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup unsalted butter",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup crunchy peanut butter",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","2 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Classic Peanut Butter Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons baking soda",
"Step 1","Cream butter, peanut butter, and sugars together in a bowl; beat in eggs."
"Step 2","In a separate bowl, sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; stir into butter mixture. Put dough in refrigerator for 1 hour."
"Step 3","Roll dough into 1 inch balls and put on baking sheets. Flatten each ball with a fork, making a crisscross pattern. Bake in a preheated 375 degrees F oven for about 10 minutes or until cookies begin to brown."
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","1 .5 cups white sugar",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","1 cup softened butter",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","2 .75 cups all-purpose flour",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","2 teaspoons cream of tartar",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies",".25 teaspoon salt",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","2 tablespoons white sugar",
"Grandma Ruth's Snickerdoodle Cookies","2 teaspoons ground cinnamon",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or lightly grease."
"Step 2","Beat 1 1/2 cups white sugar, butter, and eggs together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Combine flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into creamed butter mixture until dough holds together."
"Step 3","Mix 2 tablespoons white sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl."
"Step 4","Form dough into 2-teaspoon-size balls and roll in the cinnamon-sugar mixture. Place dough balls, about 2 inches apart, on the prepared baking sheet."
"Step 5","Bake in the preheated oven on the center rack for 7 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack."
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies",".75 cup packed brown sugar",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies",".25 cup white sugar",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 (3.5 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Mom's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars. Add pudding mix, eggs and vanilla. Combine flour and baking soda; add to creamed mixture and mix well. Fold in chocolate chips."
"Step 3","Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned."
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","4 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 teaspoons baking soda",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 cups butter, softened",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .5 cups packed brown sugar",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 (3.4 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","4 large eggs eggs",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","4 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Award Winning Soft Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 cups chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour and baking soda, set aside."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar. Beat in the instant pudding mix until blended. Stir in the eggs and vanilla. Blend in the flour mixture. Finally, stir in the chocolate chips and nuts. Drop cookies by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Edges should be golden brown."
"No Bake Cookies III","2 cups white sugar",
"No Bake Cookies III","3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder",
"No Bake Cookies III",".5 cup margarine",
"No Bake Cookies III",".5 cup milk",
"No Bake Cookies III","1 pinch salt",
"No Bake Cookies III","3 cups quick cooking oats",
"No Bake Cookies III",".5 cup peanut butter",
"No Bake Cookies III","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Step 1","In a saucepan bring sugar, cocoa, margarine, milk, and salt to a rapid boil for 1 minute."
"Step 2","Add quick cooking oats, peanut butter, and vanilla; mix well."
"Step 3","Working quickly, drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper, and let cool."
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","1 egg",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","1 teaspoon grated orange zest",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","2 tablespoons orange juice",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","2 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","2 cups chopped cranberries",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies",".5 cup chopped walnuts",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies",".5 teaspoon grated orange zest",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","3 tablespoons orange juice",
"Cranberry Orange Cookies","1 .5 cups confectioners' sugar",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the egg until well blended. Mix in 1 teaspoon orange zest and 2 tablespoons orange juice. Combine the flour, baking soda and salt; stir into the orange mixture. Mix in cranberries and if using, walnuts, until evenly distributed. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Cookies should be spaced at least 2 inches apart."
"Step 3","Bake for 12 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are golden. Remove from cookie sheets to cool on wire racks."
"Step 4","In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 teaspoon orange zest, 3 tablespoons orange juice and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Spread over the tops of cooled cookies. Let stand until set."
"Easy Lemon Cookies","1 (18.25 ounce) package lemon cake mix",
"Easy Lemon Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Easy Lemon Cookies",".33 cup vegetable oil",
"Easy Lemon Cookies","1 teaspoon lemon extract",
"Easy Lemon Cookies",".33 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Pour cake mix into a large bowl. Stir in eggs, oil, and lemon extract until well blended. Drop teaspoonfuls of dough into a bowl of confectioners' sugar. Roll them around until they're lightly covered. Once sugared, put them on an ungreased cookie sheet."
"Step 3","Bake for 6 to 9 minutes in the preheated oven. The bottoms will be light brown, and the insides chewy."
"Rainbow Cookies","8 ounces almond paste",
"Rainbow Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"Rainbow Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Rainbow Cookies","4 large eggs eggs, separated",
"Rainbow Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Rainbow Cookies","6 drops red food coloring",
"Rainbow Cookies","6 drops green food coloring",
"Rainbow Cookies",".25 cup seedless red raspberry jam",
"Rainbow Cookies",".25 cup apricot jam",
"Rainbow Cookies","1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, melted",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line three 9x13 inch baking pans with parchment paper."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, break apart almond paste with a fork, and cream together with butter, sugar, and egg yolks. When mixture is fluffy and smooth, stir in flour to form a dough. In a small bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites into the dough. Divide dough into 3 equal portions. Mix one portion with red food coloring, and one with green food coloring. Spread each portion into one of the prepared baking pans."
"Step 3","Bake 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until lightly browned. Carefully remove from pan and parchment paper, and cool completely on wire racks."
"Step 4","Place green layer onto a piece of plastic wrap large enough to wrap all three layers. Spread green layer with raspberry jam, and top with uncolored layer. Spread with apricot jam, and top with pink layer. Transfer layers to a baking sheet, and enclose with plastic wrap. Place a heavy pan or cutting board on top of wrapped layers to compress. Chill in the refrigerator 8 hours, or overnight."
"Step 5","Remove plastic wrap. Top with melted chocolate chips, and refrigerate 1 hour, or until chocolate is firm. Slice into small squares to serve."
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup packed light brown sugar",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","3 cups quick-cooking oats",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup chopped walnuts",
"Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until just blended. Mix in the quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely."
"Molasses Cookies",".75 cup margarine, melted",
"Molasses Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Molasses Cookies","1 egg",
"Molasses Cookies",".25 cup molasses",
"Molasses Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Molasses Cookies","2 teaspoons baking soda",
"Molasses Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Molasses Cookies","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Molasses Cookies",".5 teaspoon ground cloves",
"Molasses Cookies",".5 teaspoon ground ginger",
"Molasses Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Step 1","In a medium bowl, mix together the melted margarine, 1 cup sugar, and egg until smooth. Stir in the molasses. Combine the flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, cloves, and ginger; blend into the molasses mixture. Cover, and chill dough for 1 hour."
"Step 2","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Roll dough into walnut sized balls, and roll them in the remaining white sugar. Place cookies 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until tops are cracked. Cool on wire racks."
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .75 cups all-purpose flour",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking powder",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies",".25 teaspoon salt",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup unsalted butter",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies",".75 cup semisweet chocolate chips",
"Tina's Shortbread Chocolate Chip Cookies",".5 cup chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt, set aside. In a medium bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until fluffy. Gradually stir in the dry ingredients, then stir in the walnuts and chocolate chips."
"Step 3","Roll or scoop dough into walnut sized balls. Place them on unprepared cookie sheets 1 1/2 inches apart. Flatten cookies slightly. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until light golden brown. Remove from sheets to cool on racks."
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV",".67 cup shortening",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV",".67 cup butter",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","1 .5 cups white sugar",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","2 large eggs eggs",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","3 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","2 teaspoons baking powder",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV","1 teaspoon salt",
"Soft Sugar Cookies IV",".33 cup granulated sugar for decoration",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream together the butter, shortening and sugar. Stir in the eggs and vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt, stir into the creamed mixture until dough comes together. Roll dough into walnut sized balls and roll the balls in sugar. Place them on an unprepared cookie sheet about 2 inches apart."
"Step 3","Bake cookies 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until bottom is light brown. Remove from baking sheets to cool on wire racks."
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","2 tablespoons all-purpose flour",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","2 teaspoons ground ginger",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons ground cinnamon",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons baking soda",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".5 teaspoon fine salt",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".25 teaspoon ground cloves",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".25 teaspoon ground black pepper",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","12 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".67 cup white sugar",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".33 cup finely minced candied ginger",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".25 cup molasses",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".5 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies","1 large egg, beaten",
"Chef John's Gingersnap Cookies",".5 cup white sugar, or as needed for rolling cookies",
"Step 1","Whisk 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons flour, ground ginger, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, cloves, black pepper, and cayenne together in a large mixing bowl until thoroughly mixed."
"Step 2","Cream together butter and 2/3 cup sugar in a separate bowl until pale yellow and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add candied ginger, molasses, vanilla, and egg. Whisk mixture until well blended. Add dry ingredients to butter/sugar mixture and stir just until the flour disappears. Cover dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour."
"Step 3","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Pour 1/2 cup white sugar in a shallow dish for rolling cookies."
"Step 4","Scoop out about 1 1/2 teaspoons dough with a small scoop or teaspoon. Form dough into balls and roll in white sugar. Place cookies on prepared baking sheet. Slightly flatten cookies to about 1/4 inch thick; sprinkle with a pinch more sugar."
"Step 5","Bake in preheated oven until cookies are your desired crispiness or chewiness, 10 to 15 minutes."
"Cake Mix Cookies VIII","1 (18.25 ounce) package chocolate cake mix",
"Cake Mix Cookies VIII",".5 cup butter, softened",
"Cake Mix Cookies VIII","2 large eggs eggs",
"Cake Mix Cookies VIII","1 cup semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, stir together the cake mix, butter and eggs until smooth and well blended. Mix in the chocolate chips. Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely."
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie",".75 cup unsalted butter, melted",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie",".5 cup white sugar",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","1 tablespoon vanilla extract",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","1 egg",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","1 egg yolk",
"Best Big, Fat, Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookie","2 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or line with parchment paper."
"Step 2","Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt; set aside."
"Step 3","In a medium bowl, cream together the melted butter, brown sugar and white sugar until well blended. Beat in the vanilla, egg, and egg yolk until light and creamy. Mix in the sifted ingredients until just blended. Stir in the chocolate chips by hand using a wooden spoon. Drop cookie dough 1/4 cup at a time onto the prepared cookie sheets. Cookies should be about 3 inches apart."
"Step 4","Bake for 15 to 17 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are lightly toasted. Cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely."
"Cake Mix Cookies IV","2 large eggs eggs",
"Cake Mix Cookies IV","1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix",
"Cake Mix Cookies IV",".5 cup vegetable oil",
"Step 1","Mix together cake mix, eggs and oil in a large bowl."
"Step 2","Make little balls with the dough and set on ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 4 - 10 minutes."
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 cup unsalted butter",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 cup creamy peanut butter",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon kosher salt",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking powder",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies","1 egg",
"Chef John's Peanut Butter Cookies","1 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"Step 1","Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar, peanut butter, salt, baking powder, and baking soda in a stand mixer until smooth."
"Step 2","Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beater with a spatula. Add egg and mix for about 1 minute."
"Step 3","Slowly mix in flour with the mixer on low. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and beater. Mix on medium until combined, about 30 seconds."
"Step 4","Form dough into a ball, cover with plastic and refrigerate for 2-3 hours."
"Step 5","Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 6","Portion out cookie dough in equal-sized balls on a baking sheet covered with a silicone baking mat. Use damp hands to roll dough into smooth balls. Stamp each ball with a fork in a criss-cross pattern."
"Step 7","Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes until golden."
"Step 8","Leave on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack."
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars",".5 cup packed light brown sugar",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars","1 cup all-purpose flour",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars",".25 teaspoon baking soda",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars","⅛ teaspoon salt",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars","1 cup rolled oats",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars",".5 cup butter, softened",
"Delicious Raspberry Oatmeal Cookie Bars",".75 cup seedless raspberry jam",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 8 inch square pan, and line with greased foil."
"Step 2","Combine brown sugar, flour, baking soda, salt, and rolled oats. Rub in the butter using your hands or a pastry blender to form a crumbly mixture. Press 2 cups of the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan. Spread the jam to within 1/4 inch of the edge. Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture over the top, and lightly press it into the jam."
"Step 3","Bake for 35 to 40 minutes in preheated oven, or until lightly browned. Allow to cool before cutting into bars."
"Shortbread Cookies II","2 cups butter, softened",
"Shortbread Cookies II","1 cup white sugar",
"Shortbread Cookies II","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Shortbread Cookies II","4 cups all-purpose flour",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Stir in vanilla; add flour and mix well."
"Step 3","Put through cookie press and form cookies onto baking sheets. Bake for 10 - 12 minutes."
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","1 .75 cups all-purpose flour",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies",".5 cup butter, softened",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies",".5 cup peanut butter",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","1 egg, beaten",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","2 tablespoons milk",
"Peanut Butter Cup Cookies","40 eaches miniature chocolate covered peanut butter cups, unwrapped",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the flour, salt and baking soda; set aside."
"Step 2","Cream together the butter, sugar, peanut butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla and milk. Add the flour mixture; mix well. Shape into 40 balls and place each into an ungreased mini muffin pan."
"Step 3","Bake at 375 degrees for about 8 minutes. Remove from oven and immediately press a mini peanut butter cup into each ball. Cool and carefully remove from pan.St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup butter",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies",".75 cup white sugar",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 egg",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 .5 cups grated zucchini",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup quick cooking oats",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup granola",
"St. Patrick's Day Zucchini-Oatmeal Cookies","2 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Stir in the egg and vanilla, mix well, then stir in the shredded zucchini. Sift together the flour, baking soda and cinnamon, stir into the zucchini mixture. Finally, stir in the oats, granola and chocolate chips."
"Step 3","Drop dough from a teaspoon onto an unprepared cookie sheet. Leave at least 2 inches between cookies. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. The cookies will stay soft and moist because of the zucchini."
"PMS Cookies","4 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"PMS Cookies","2 cups peanut butter chips",
"PMS Cookies","1 (8 ounce) bag plain salted potato chips",
"PMS Cookies","2 .5 cups dry-roasted peanuts",
"Step 1","In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate and peanut butter chips for about 3 minutes on high. Stir every 30 seconds after the first minute until chips are melted and smooth. Slightly crush the potato chips before stirring into the mixture along with the peanuts. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper and let stand until chocolate is set, about 15 minutes. Store at room temperature or in the refrigerator."
"Florentine Cookies",".67 cup butter",
"Florentine Cookies","2 cups quick-cooking oats",
"Florentine Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Florentine Cookies",".67 cup all-purpose flour",
"Florentine Cookies",".25 cup corn syrup",
"Florentine Cookies",".25 cup milk",
"Florentine Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Florentine Cookies",".25 teaspoon salt",
"Florentine Cookies","1 cup semisweet chocolate chips (such as Nestle® Toll House®)",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line 2 cookie sheets with aluminum foil."
"Step 2","Melt butter in a large saucepan. Remove from heat and mix in oats, sugar, flour, corn syrup, milk, vanilla, and salt until well combined. Drop by level teaspoonfuls 3 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Spread cookies out thin with a rubber spatula."
"Step 3","Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes. Cool on the cookie sheets."
"Step 4","Meanwhile, place chocolate chips in the top of a double boiler over simmering water. Stir frequently, scraping down the sides with a rubber spatula to avoid scorching, until chocolate is melted and smooth, about 5 minutes."
"Step 5","Peel foil from cookies. Spread melted chocolate on 1/2 of the cookies. Top with the remaining cookies."
"S'mores Cookie","2 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"S'mores Cookie","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"S'mores Cookie","1 teaspoon salt",
"S'mores Cookie",".5 pound butter, at room temperature",
"S'mores Cookie",".75 cup packed brown sugar",
"S'mores Cookie",".25 cup white sugar",
"S'mores Cookie","1 (3.4 ounce) package instant vanilla pudding mix (such as Jell-O®)",
"S'mores Cookie","2 large eggs",
"S'mores Cookie","1 teaspoon vanilla extract, or more to taste",
"S'mores Cookie","1 cup semisweet chocolate chunks",
"S'mores Cookie","1 cup honey graham cereal (such as Golden Grahams®)",
"S'mores Cookie",".5 (10.5 ounce) package miniature marshmallows",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Sift flour, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl."
"Step 3","Beat butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a large bowl using an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add instant pudding and mix well. Add eggs and vanilla extract, blending thoroughly and scraping down sides of the bowl as necessary. Slowly add flour and mix well. Stir in chocolate chunks and cereal until well combined."
"Step 4","Drop cookie dough onto an ungreased baking sheet using a 2-ounce ice cream scoop. Use rounded tablespoons if you prefer smaller cookies."
"Step 5","Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 15 minutes. Place 5 or 6 marshmallows on top of each cookie."
"Step 6","Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Place cookies under broiler, leaving the door open. Bake until marshmallows are slightly toasted, 15 to 30 seconds, watching carefully. Remove cookies from oven. Let rest for 1 minute before cooling on a wire rack."
"Chocolate Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Chocolate Cookies",".5 cup shortening",
"Chocolate Cookies","2 (1 ounce) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted",
"Chocolate Cookies","1 egg",
"Chocolate Cookies",".5 cup buttermilk",
"Chocolate Cookies","1 cup chopped walnuts",
"Chocolate Cookies",".25 teaspoon baking soda",
"Chocolate Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Chocolate Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Chocolate Cookies","1 .5 cups cake flour",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Cream brown sugar, shortening, melted chocolate, egg and buttermilk."
"Step 3","Add dry ingredients and beat until smooth."
"Step 4","Drop onto greased cookie sheet and bake for 12 to 15 minutes. Ice with Chocolate Cookie Buttercream Frosting when still warm but not hot."
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","1 cup Karo® Light Corn Syrup",
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","1 cup sugar",
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","1 cup creamy peanut butter",
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","6 cups crispy rice cereal",
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips",
"Chocolate Scotcheroos","1 cup butterscotch chips",
"Step 1","Cook corn syrup and sugar together in a large pan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter; mix well. Add cereal; stir until evenly coated."
"Step 2","Pour into greased 13x9-inch pan and pat into place."
"Step 3","Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips together in saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Spread over cereal."
"Step 4","Cool at least 45 minutes, or until firm. Cut into bars."
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".75 cup margarine, softened",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".5 cup white sugar",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","2 large eggs eggs",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 .75 cups all-purpose flour",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 .5 teaspoons baking powder",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".75 cup flaked coconut",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".75 cup chopped pitted dates",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".75 cup raisins",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","2 cups grated zucchini",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 tablespoon margarine, melted",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","2 tablespoons milk",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars",".25 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 cup confectioners' sugar",
"Zucchini-Coconut Cookie Bars","1 cup finely chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar. Mix in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla until fluffy. Sift together the flour, salt, and baking powder; stir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the coconut, dates, raisins, and zucchini. Spread batter into the prepared pan."
"Step 3","Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes. To make icing, mix together melted margarine, milk, 1 teaspoon vanilla, cinnamon, and confectioners' sugar. Drizzle icing over the bars while still warm. Sprinkle chopped nuts over icing. Cut into bars when cool."
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","3 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup cake flour",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .5 cups butter, softened",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .25 cups white sugar",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .25 cups packed brown sugar",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 tablespoon vanilla extract",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Chewy Jumbo Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Sift together the all-purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder and baking soda; set aside."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs and vanilla, until well blended. Gradually stir in the flour mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips by hand using a wooden spoon, stir in walnuts if desired. Drop cookies by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 10 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are light brown. Let cookies cool on the baking sheet before removing to wire racks to cool completely."
"Raisin Cookies","2 cups packed brown sugar",
"Raisin Cookies","1 cup shortening",
"Raisin Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Raisin Cookies","3 cups all-purpose flour",
"Raisin Cookies","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Raisin Cookies","1 .75 teaspoons baking soda",
"Raisin Cookies",".75 cup milk",
"Raisin Cookies",".75 cup raisins",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream the shortening and brown sugar. Add eggs, mix well. Sift together the flour, cinnamon and baking soda; stir into the creamed mixture. Finally, stir in the milk and the raisins."
"Step 3","Drop dough by rounded spoonfuls onto an unprepared cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from baking sheet to cool on wire racks."
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies",".5 cup unsalted butter, softened",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","1 cup ricotta cheese, at room temperature",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","2 tablespoons lemon juice",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","1 tablespoon almond extract",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies",".5 teaspoon lemon zest",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","1 large egg, room temperature",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons baking powder",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies",".5 cup powdered sugar",
"Lemony Almond-Ricotta Cookies","2 tablespoons lemon juice",
"Step 1","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper."
"Step 2","Beat sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on low speed until blended. Increase speed to high and beat until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Beat in ricotta cheese, lemon juice, almond extract, lemon zest, and egg on medium speed until well combined. Reduce speed to low. Add flour, baking powder, and salt; beat slowly until a dough forms."
"Step 3","Drop dough about 2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheet using a cookie scoop."
"Step 4","Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are very lightly golden but still soft, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven, transfer to a wire rack, and cool completely before icing, about 30 minutes."
"Step 5","Stir powdered sugar and lemon juice together in a small bowl to make a smooth icing. Drizzle icing onto the cookies. Set cookies aside to allow icing to dry completely."
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","2 .5 cups shortening",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","1 teaspoon anise seed, ground",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","6 cups all-purpose flour",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","1 tablespoon baking powder",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies",".5 tablespoon cream of tartar",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies",".25 cup orange juice",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","3 tablespoons ground cinnamon",
"Mexican Sugar Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Beat shortening until light and fluffy. Add one cup sugar, and anise seed. Mix until creamy. Add eggs and mix well. Add flour, baking power, cream of tartar, salt and orange juice. Mix well."
"Step 3","Knead dough until smooth. On lightly floured surface, roll to 1/2 inch thick. Cut using cookie cutter into different shapes. Bake until light brown, 5 - 8 minutes. Roll cookies in mixture of 1 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons of cinnamon while still warm."
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","4 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","4 large eggs eggs",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","1 pound confectioners' sugar",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","1 tablespoon lemon zest",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","1 tablespoon anise seed, ground",
"German Anise Christmas Cookies (Springerle)","1 tablespoon anise seed, crushed",
"Step 1","Sift together the flour and baking powder, set aside. In a large bowl, whip the eggs and sugar until thick and light. Stir in the lemon zest and ground anise. Add the flour mixture, mix well. Cover and chill dough for about an hour."
"Step 2","On a lightly floured surface, roll the dough out to 1/2 inch thickness. Traditionally, you would roll over the dough with a springerle rolling pin, but the dough can be cut into small shapes of any kind. Place cookies 1/2 inch apart on baking sheets, sprinkle with anise seed and leave out uncovered, overnight."
"Step 3","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake cookies for 25 to 30 minutes."
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies",".5 cup unsalted butter, softened",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 tablespoon unsalted butter, softened",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies",".67 cup white sugar",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 individual packet vanilla sugar",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 egg",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","3 tablespoons confectioners' sugar",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","2 teaspoons lemon juice, or more if needed",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 drop assorted food coloring",
"Easy German Cut-Out Cookies","1 (1.75 ounce) package multicolored candy sprinkles, or as desired",
"Step 1","Combine 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon butter, white sugar, vanilla sugar, and egg in a bowl. Beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy."
"Step 2","Mix flour and baking powder together. Beat into the butter mixture on low speed until dough becomes crumbly. Work dough crumbles with your hands into a smooth dough and place into a sealable container. Refrigerate until chilled, 1 to 2 hours."
"Step 3","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper."
"Step 4","Roll the dough out to 1/4-inch thickness on a lightly floured surface and cut into desired shapes using cookie cutters. Place cookies 1 inch apart on the prepared baking sheets."
"Step 5","Pick up all the left over dough, press together into a ball, and repeat the rolling and cutting out process until all the dough is used up."
"Step 6","Bake in the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before carefully removing to a wire rack with a knife or thin spatula to cool completely."
"Step 7","Mix confectioners' sugar and lemon juice until glaze has a smooth and spreadable consistency. Add more lemon juice if you like a thinner glaze. Add food coloring if you like. Brush frosting on cooled cookies and add chocolate sprinkles or sugar sprinkles if desired."
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","2 cups shortening",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","2 cups white sugar",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","2 cups brown sugar",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","2 cups peanut butter",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","4 eaches eggs",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Slice-and-Bake Peanut Butter Cookies","4 teaspoons baking soda",
"Step 1","Set out four 12x14-inch long pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap."
"Step 2","Cream shortening, white sugar, brown sugar, and peanut butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer. Beat in vanilla extract and eggs until light and fluffy."
"Step 3","Mix together flour and baking soda in a separate bowl until well combined. Gradually add flour mixture into the egg mixture, stirring until blended."
"Step 4","Divide dough into 4 pieces and form each piece into an 8 to 10-inch roll. Wrap rolls in prepared waxed paper or plastic wrap and place in the freezer until ready to bake."
"Step 5","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper."
"Step 6","Remove dough from freezer and cut into 1-inch thick slices. Cut each slice into quarters and roll each piece into a ball. Place on the prepared baking sheet and use a fork to flatten with a nice crisscross design."
"Step 7","Bake in the preheated oven until lightly brown around the edges, 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on racks."
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies",".5 cup hot water",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 cup dried currants",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 cup shortening",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","2 cups brown sugar",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","3 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","1 cup buttermilk",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies",".5 cup chopped walnuts",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","6 tablespoons butter",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies",".25 cup hot water",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies",".5 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Currant Nut Drop Cookies","4 cups confectioners' sugar",
"Step 1","In a small bowl, soak currants in 1/2 cup of hot water until swollen; drain and set aside. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the shortening and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the 1 teaspoon vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt, stir into the creamed mixture alternately with the buttermilk. Fold in the chopped walnuts and dried currants. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. When the cookies are cool, frost with the brown butter frosting."
"Step 4","To make the frosting: Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium hat until golden brown. Stir in the 1/4 cup of water and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in the confectioners' sugar 1/2 cup at a time until icing is of a spreadable consistency."
"Williamsburg Cookies","2 large egg whites egg whites",
"Williamsburg Cookies","2 cups light brown sugar",
"Williamsburg Cookies","2 cups chopped pecans",
"Williamsburg Cookies","2 tablespoons all-purpose flour",
"Williamsburg Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Williamsburg Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Williamsburg Cookies",".5 tablespoon ground cinnamon",
"Step 1","Beat egg whites until stiff. Add salt and beat. Add brown sugar gradually. Sprinkle flour over pecans and add to mixture. Add vanilla."
"Step 2","Drop by teaspoon onto greased cookie sheet. (Use low fat, non-stick spray for less fat). Bake at 275 degrees F (135 degrees C) for 12 - 15 minutes."
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 cup shortening",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 cup brown sugar",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 tablespoon grated orange zest",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","3 tablespoons molasses",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 cup all-purpose flour",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Oatmeal Refrigerator Cookies","3 cups rolled oats",
"Step 1","In a large bowl, cream together the shortening, white sugar and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the orange zest, molasses and vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda and salt; stir into the molasses mixture until well blended. Mix in oats."
"Step 2","Divide the dough into halves, and shape into long logs about 2 inches in diameter. Wrap in waxed paper, and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight."
"Step 3","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice chilled dough into rounds about 1/4 inch thick. Place 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 4","Bake for 11 to 13 minutes in the preheated oven, until the bottoms are lightly browned. Cool on the baking pan for a minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely."
"The Cookie Jar","1 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"The Cookie Jar",".5 cup brown sugar",
"The Cookie Jar","4 ounces chocolate chips",
"The Cookie Jar","4 ounces white chocolate chips",
"The Cookie Jar",".25 cup white sugar",
"The Cookie Jar",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"The Cookie Jar",".5 teaspoon salt",
"The Cookie Jar",".5 cup butter, softened",
"The Cookie Jar","1 egg",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Whisk flour, brown sugar, chocolate chips, white chocolate chips, white sugar, baking soda and salt together in a bowl. Stir butter and egg into flour mixture until dough is just mixed; drop by the spoonful onto a baking sheet."
"Step 3","Bake in the preheated oven until edges of cookie are lightly browned, about 10 minutes."
"Speculaas Cookies","1 .5 cups brown sugar",
"Speculaas Cookies","1 cup unsalted butter, softened",
"Speculaas Cookies","1 egg",
"Speculaas Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons ground cinnamon",
"Speculaas Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Speculaas Cookies",".5 teaspoon ground cloves",
"Speculaas Cookies",".5 teaspoon ground nutmeg",
"Speculaas Cookies","3 cups all-purpose flour",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dust 2 baking sheets with flour."
"Step 2","Combine brown sugar and butter together in a bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in egg, cinnamon, baking powder, cloves, and nutmeg. Mix in flour, 1 cup at a time, until dough comes together."
"Step 3","Shape dough into cookies by hand or using cookie cutters. Arrange on the prepared baking sheet."
"Step 4","Bake in the preheated oven until firm but not hard, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool."
"Polish Christmas Cookies","1 cup butter",
"Polish Christmas Cookies","1 cup shortening",
"Polish Christmas Cookies","2 cups white sugar",
"Polish Christmas Cookies","5 large eggs eggs",
"Polish Christmas Cookies","7 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Polish Christmas Cookies","6 teaspoons baking powder",
"Polish Christmas Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Polish Christmas Cookies",".5 ounce anise extract",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Cream the butter, shortening and the sugar together. Stir in the eggs and continue to beat. Add the anise flavoring. Stir in 7 cups of the flour, the baking powder and the salt. Mix until the dough is soft. Add the additional cup of flour if needed. Chill the dough."
"Step 3","On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough and cut with cookie cutters. Place cookies on greased cookie sheets."
"Step 4","Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes. Frost and decorate when cookies are cooled.Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","1 cup butter, melted",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","1 cup dark brown sugar",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars",".5 cup white sugar",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","2 large eggs eggs",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","1 teaspoon salt",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars",".25 teaspoon baking powder",
"Kirsten's Dark Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars","2 cups dark chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish."
"Step 2","Mix butter, brown sugar, and white sugar together in a bowl; beat it eggs and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy. Stir flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder into the creamed butter mixture until batter is well mixed. Fold chocolate chips into batter; spread into the prepared baking dish."
"Step 3","Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes. Cool before cutting into bars."
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 cup butter",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 .25 cups packed brown sugar",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","2 large eggs eggs",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 tablespoon honey",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","3 cups rolled oats",
"Oatmeal Raisin Cookies VI","1 cup raisins",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until smooth. Stir in the eggs, vanilla and honey. Sift together the flour, baking soda and cinnamon, gradually stir into the creamed mixture. Finally, stir in the rolled oats and raisins."
"Step 3","Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto unprepared cookie sheets. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until cookies start to brown. Remove from baking sheets to cool on wire racks."
"Brown Butter Cookies","2 cups butter",
"Brown Butter Cookies","2 cups brown sugar",
"Brown Butter Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Brown Butter Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Brown Butter Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Brown Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking powder",
"Brown Butter Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Brown Butter Cookies","3 cups all-purpose flour",
"Brown Butter Cookies",".67 cup chopped pecans",
"Brown Butter Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Brown Butter Cookies","3 .5 cups confectioners' sugar",
"Brown Butter Cookies",".5 cup hot water",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Heat butter over medium heat for 5 minutes or so, until it turns nut brown in color. The foaming and bubbling is part of the browning process, but watch it carefully so that you don't burn the butter. Remove from heat, and cool slightly. Reserve 1/2 cup of the butter for the frosting."
"Step 3","Pour remaining browned butter into a large mixing bowl. Beat browned butter with brown sugar until the butter is no longer hot. Mix in eggs, 2 teaspoons vanilla, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Beat thoroughly. Mix in flour and chopped pecans. Drop tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets."
"Step 4","Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until light brown around the edges. Cool."
"Step 5","In a medium bowl, mix the reserved 1/2 cup browned butter with 2 teaspoons vanilla, confectioners' sugar, and hot water. Beat until smooth, and use to frost cooled cookies."
"Pumpkin Cookies I",".5 cup shortening",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 cup white sugar",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 cup pumpkin puree",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Pumpkin Cookies I",".25 teaspoon salt",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Pumpkin Cookies I","1 .5 cups butterscotch chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream the shortening and sugar. Stir in the pumpkin and vanilla. Sift together the flour, salt, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon; stir into the creamed mixture. Then mix in the butterscotch chips. Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool for a minute on cookie sheets before transferring to wire cooling racks."
"Seven Layer Bars",".5 cup unsalted butter",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 .5 cups graham cracker crumbs",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 cup semisweet chocolate chips",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 cup butterscotch chips",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 cup chopped walnuts",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk",
"Seven Layer Bars","1 .33 cups shredded coconut",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Place butter in 13 x 9 inch pan and melt in oven. Swirl to coat bottom and sides with butter."
"Step 3","Spread graham cracker crumbs evenly over bottom of pan. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and nuts over crumbs. Pour condensed milk over nuts. Sprinkle coconut over condensed milk."
"Step 4","Bake until edges are golden brown, about 25 minutes. Let cool before cutting into bars."
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","2 cups peanut butter",
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","2 cups white sugar",
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","2 large eggs eggs",
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","2 teaspoons baking soda",
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","1 pinch salt",
"Best Peanut Butter Cookies Ever","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, stir peanut butter and sugar together until smooth. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the baking soda, salt, and vanilla. Roll dough into 1 inch balls and place them 2 inches apart onto the prepared cookie sheets. Press a criss-cross into the top using the back of a fork."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely."
"Peppermint Meringues","2 large egg whites egg whites",
"Peppermint Meringues","⅛ teaspoon salt",
"Peppermint Meringues","⅛ teaspoon cream of tartar",
"Peppermint Meringues",".5 cup white sugar",
"Peppermint Meringues","2 eaches peppermint candy canes, crushed",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C). Line 2 cookie sheets with foil."
"Step 2","In a large glass or metal mixing bowl, beat egg whites, salt, and cream of tartar to soft peaks. Gradually add sugar, continuing to beat until whites form stiff peaks. Drop by spoonfuls 1 inch apart on the prepared cookie sheets. Sprinkle crushed peppermint candy over the cookies."
"Step 3","Bake for 1 1/2 hours in preheated oven. Meringues should be completely dry on the inside. Do not allow them to brown. Turn off oven. Keep oven door ajar, and let meringues sit in the oven until completely cool. Loosen from foil with metal spatula. Store loosely covered in cool dry place for up to 2 months."
"Italian Cookies I",".5 cup butter, softened",
"Italian Cookies I",".5 cup white sugar",
"Italian Cookies I","3 large eggs eggs",
"Italian Cookies I","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Italian Cookies I","3 cups all-purpose flour",
"Italian Cookies I","3 teaspoons baking powder",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Mix in the egg and vanilla. Combine the flour and baking powder; stir into the creamed mixture until blended. Divide dough into walnut sized portions. Roll each piece into a rope and then shape into a loop. Place cookies 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until firm and golden at the edges."
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 cup unsalted butter",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 tablespoons milk",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon baking powder",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","2 .5 cups rolled oats",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","3 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Jack's Chocolate Chip Cookies","1 .5 cups chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream the butter, brown sugar and white sugar until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, beating after each addition. Stir in the milk and vanilla. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt, stir into the creamed mixture. Using a wooden spoon, stir in the rolled oats, chocolate chips and walnuts."
"Step 3","Roll the dough into walnut sized balls, and place 2 inches apart on an unprepared cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool cookies on wire racks."
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 cup butter",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 .5 cups confectioners' sugar",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 egg",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies",".5 teaspoon almond extract",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","2 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Easy Valentine Sandwich Cookies","1 teaspoon cream of tartar",
"Step 1","In a large bowl, cream together butter and confectioners' sugar. Beat in egg, vanilla and almond extract. Mix well."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, stir together flour, baking soda and cream of tartar; blend into the butter mixture. Divide dough into thirds and shape into balls."
"Step 3","Working with 1/3 of dough at a time, roll out dough into desired thickness on a lightly floured surface. For each heart sandwich cookie, cut out 2 3-inch hearts. Cut out the center of ONE of the 3-inch hearts with the 1 1/2-inch cutter."
"Step 4","Place each piece separately on an ungreased cookie sheet, 1 - 2 inches apart. Bake in a preheated, 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven until lightly browned (7-8 minutes for 1/4 inch thick cookies). Cool completely on wire rack. Frost bottom cookie with Pink Valentine Frosting and place an open centered cookie on top to form the sandwich. Also frost the small 1 1/2 inch hearts and serve as separate cookies."
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","2 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies",".25 cup unsweetened cocoa powder",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","1 cup butter, room temperature",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies",".75 cup brown sugar",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies",".75 cup white sugar",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","2 eaches large eggs",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","2 tablespoons vanilla extract",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies",".5 cup chocolate-hazelnut spread, such as Nutella®",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies",".5 cup chopped toasted hazelnuts",
"Nutella® Hazelnut Cookies","1 cup chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper."
"Step 2","Combine flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Mix with a whisk to break up any lumps."
"Step 3","Beat butter, brown sugar, and white sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time until completely incorporated. Mix in vanilla and chocolate-hazelnut spread."
"Step 4","Slowly add in flour mixture and stir just until combined. Fold in chopped hazelnuts and chocolate chips. Drop the dough onto prepared baking sheet by tablespoons or with a cookie scoop."
"Step 5","Bake in preheated oven until edges look dry and cookies are fragrant, about 12 minutes. Allow to cool for 1 minute on baking sheet before transferring to a wire rack."
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 tablespoon grated orange zest",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon orange extract",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","3 cups rolled oats",
"Cranberry Orange Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup dried cranberries",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar and white sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla, orange zest and orange extract. Combine the flour, baking soda and cinnamon; stir into the butter mixture. Stir in the oats and cranberries. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely."
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup sifted whole wheat flour",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies",".75 cup butter, softened",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies","1 .5 cups brown sugar",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies","1 egg",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies",".25 cup water",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Henry and Maudie's Oatmeal Cookies","3 cups rolled oats",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets. Stir together the whole wheat flour, salt and baking soda; set aside."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Stir in the egg, water and vanilla. Mix in the flour mixture, then stir in the oats. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheets. Cookies should be about 2 inches apart."
"Step 3","Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from baking sheets to cool on wire racks."
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies",".67 cup butter, softened",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies",".67 cup packed brown sugar",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies","1 .5 cups rolled oats",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies","1 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies","1 .25 cups dried cranberries",
"Oatmeal Cranberry White Chocolate Chunk Cookies",".67 cup coarsely chopped white chocolate",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Combine oats, flour, salt, and baking soda; stir into butter mixture one cup at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in dried cranberries and white chocolate. Drop by rounded teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in preheated oven, or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks."
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","1 cup butter, softened",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","1 egg",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","1 tablespoon orange zest",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","2 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies",".75 teaspoon baking soda",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","2 cups white chocolate chips",
"White Chocolate Orange Cookies","1 cup chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Cream the butter and sugars together until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and orange zest. Stir the flour, baking soda, and salt together; mix into the creamed mixture. Stir in the white chocolate chips and chopped walnuts. Drop tablespoonfuls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow to cool on the baking sheet for 2 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely."
"Brown Sugar Cookies II",".67 cup shortening",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II",".67 cup butter, softened",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","1 cup white sugar",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","2 large eggs eggs",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","3 .25 cups all-purpose flour",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Brown Sugar Cookies II","1 teaspoon salt",
"Step 1","Mix shortening, butter or margarine, sugars, eggs and vanilla thoroughly. Stir in all purpose or unbleached flour, baking soda and salt."
"Step 2","Turn dough onto lightly floured board. Shape dough into ball with lightly floured hands, pressing to make dough compact. Cut dough in half."
"Step 3","Shape each half into a roll 2 inches in diameter and about 8 inches long by gently rolling dough back and forth on floured board. Roll dough onto plastic wrap: wrap and twist ends tightly. Dough can be refrigerated up to 1 month or frozen up to 3 months."
"Step 4","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 5","Cut roll into 1/4-inch slices. (It is not necessary to thaw frozen dough before slicing.) Place slices about 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 9 to 11 minutes. Immediately remove cookies from baking sheet onto wire rack."
"Step 6","CHOCOLATE CHIP: Add 1 cup mini semisweet chocolate chips and 1 cup chopped nuts with the flour. OATMEAL-COCONUT: Reduce flour to 2 3/4 cups. Add 1 cup flaked coconut and 1 cup quick-cooking oats with the flour. PEANUT BUTTER: Add 1 cup creamy or chunky peanut butter with the shortening. CHOCOLATE-NUT: Add 1 cup chopped nuts and 1/2 cup cocoa with the flour. FRUIT SLICES: Add 1 cup whole candied cherries, 1/2 cup chopped nuts and 1/2 cup cut-up mixed candied fruit with the flour."
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","1 cup margarine, softened",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","1 cup peanut butter",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","2 cups unbleached all-purpose flour",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Aunt Cora's World's Greatest Cookies","2 cups semisweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the margarine, peanut butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each. Combine the flour and baking soda; stir into the peanut butter mixture. Mix in chocolate chips. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned at the edges. Allow cookies to cool on the cookie sheets for a minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely."
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 .25 cups unsalted butter at room temperature",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies",".75 cup brown sugar",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 egg",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 .5 cups all-purpose flour",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 teaspoon ground cinnamon",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies",".25 teaspoon ground nutmeg",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","3 cups quick-cooking rolled oats",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies","1 cup butterscotch chips",
"Oatmeal Scotchies Cookies",".5 cup sweetened flaked coconut",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","In a mixing bowl, beat the butter, brown sugar, white sugar, egg, and vanilla extract until well combined. Beat in flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and rolled oats until thoroughly mixed. Stir in the butterscotch chips and coconut. Drop the dough by tablespoonfuls about 2 inches apart onto baking sheets."
"Step 3","Bake the cookies in the preheated oven just until the bottoms are light brown, 7 to 8 minutes. If you prefer crunchier cookies, bake 9 to 10 minutes."
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup shortening",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup packed brown sugar",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies","1 egg",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies","1 cup all-purpose flour",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking powder",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 teaspoon salt",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".75 cup rolled oats",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup flaked coconut",
"Crisp Oatmeal Cookies",".5 cup miniature semi-sweet chocolate chips",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets."
"Step 2","In a large bowl, cream together the shortening, white sugar and brown sugar. Mix in the egg and vanilla until well blended. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; stir into the batter until well blended. Mix in the oats, coconut and chocolate chips until evenly distributed. Roll dough into walnut sized balls and place 2 inches apart onto prepared cookie sheets."
"Step 3","Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are lightly browned."
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","Custom or prepared paper fortunes",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","1 large egg white",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies",".25 cup white sugar",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","1 tablespoon milk",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","⅛ teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","⅛ teaspoon almond extract",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","1 pinch salt",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies","1 tablespoon melted butter",
"Homemade Fortune Cookies",".33 cup all-purpose flour, or more as needed",
"Step 1","Print and cut out 3-inch wide paper fortunes."
"Step 2","Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment paper."
"Step 3","Combine egg white, sugar, milk, vanilla extract, almond extract, salt, and butter in a bowl. Whisk until sugar is dissolved. Add flour and whisk until batter is smooth and falls off the whisk in ribbons."
"Step 4","Scoop 1 tablespoon of batter onto the prepared baking sheet; spread out into a 4-inch circle using the back of a spoon. Repeat once more."
"Step 5","Bake first batch in the preheated oven until crispy and golden brown on the edges and still pale in the centers, about 10 minutes."
"Step 6","Quickly lift up cookies using a spatula. Add a fortune to each. Fold cookies in half, pressing edges together lightly. Bend each cookie over the rim of the pan, bringing ends down on either side. Lift up and curl ends towards each other. Place cookies in ramekins or muffin tins to hold their shape while they cool."
"Step 7","Bake remaining batter in batches, folding and shaping the cookies while hot. Remove from ramekins or muffin tins when completely cool.Meringue Bones and Ghosts","2 large egg whites large egg whites",
"Meringue Bones and Ghosts","2 drops fresh lemon juice, or more to taste",
"Meringue Bones and Ghosts","7 tablespoons white sugar, or more to taste",
"Meringue Bones and Ghosts","2 eaches chocolate chips, melted, or as needed",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 225 degrees F (110 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with silicone baking mats."
"Step 2","Whisk eggs whites and lemon juice together in a bowl until thick, white, and foamy. Add sugar a spoonful at a time, whisking constantly, until meringue is shiny, thick, and holds its shape."
"Step 3","Transfer meringue to a piping bag. Pipe 12 bone shapes onto a prepared baking sheet. Pipe 12 puffs to resemble ghosts onto the remaining baking sheet."
"Step 4","Bake in the preheated oven until dried and firm, about 1 hour. Turn off the oven, close the door, and cool until completely dried, about 1 hour more."
"Step 5","Dip the tip of a toothpick into melted chocolate and dot chocolate eyes on each of the ghosts."
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","1 cup butter, softened",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)",".5 cup white sugar",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","2 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","1 teaspoon freshly squeezed orange juice",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","1 teaspoon water",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)",".5 teaspoon freshly grated orange zest",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","2 cups all-purpose flour",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)","1 cup very finely chopped pecans",
"Pecan Shortbread Cookies (Mexican Wedding Cookies)",".5 cup confectioners' sugar",
"Step 1","Combine butter and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Add vanilla extract, orange juice, water, and orange zest; beat until blended. Add flour and pecans and mix with a spoon until blended but crumbly. Cover and place in the refrigerator until chilled, 3 hours to overnight."
"Step 2","Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)."
"Step 3","Scoop up about a golf-ball-size of dough and press together into a ball. Flatten and smooth the edges, making sure the dough is firm and not flaky or crumbly, or else cookies will not rise or expand as they bake. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Repeat with the rest of the dough."
"Step 4","Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for 1 minute before removing to a wire rack to cool, 8 to 10 minutes more."
"Step 5","Sift some confectioners' sugar into a small bowl. Drop a cookie into the sugar, shake the bowl, flip the cookie, and agitate again to cover in sugar. Repeat with remaining cookies, adding more sugar as necessary."
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","6 cups all-purpose flour",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 tablespoon baking powder",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 teaspoon ground nutmeg",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 pinch salt",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","2 .5 cups white sugar",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 .5 cups shortening",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 cup sour milk",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","3 large eggs eggs, beaten",
"Great Grandad's Sugar Cookies","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line cookie sheets with parchment paper."
"Step 2","In a medium bowl, stir together 4 cups flour, baking powder, nutmeg, salt, and sugar. Cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in baking soda, sour milk, beaten eggs, and vanilla. Stir as little as possible, and add the remaining flour as necessary to make dough thick enough to roll out."
"Step 3","On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough 1/4 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes with cookie cutters. Place cookies 1 inch apart on the prepared cookie sheets."
"Step 4","Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Cool on baking sheets."
"Refrigerator Cookies III","1 cup shortening",
"Refrigerator Cookies III","1 cup white sugar",
"Refrigerator Cookies III","2 large eggs eggs",
"Refrigerator Cookies III","1 .5 teaspoons vanilla extract",
"Refrigerator Cookies III","3 cups all-purpose flour",
"Refrigerator Cookies III","1 teaspoon salt",
"Refrigerator Cookies III",".5 teaspoon baking soda",
"Refrigerator Cookies III",".33 cup colored sugar for decoration",
"Step 1","Mix shortening, sugar, eggs, and vanilla together in large bowl. Stir flour, salt, and baking soda together in a separate bowl. Blend dry ingredients in with the shortening mixture. Mix thoroughly with hands."
"Step 2","Divide dough into 3 parts; shape into cylinders, 1 1/2 inches in diameter and about 7 inches long. Roll in colored sugar (or use finely chopped nuts instead). Chill for several hours or overnight."
"Step 3","Heat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Cut into 1/4 inch slices, and place on greased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool."
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup shortening",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup white sugar",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup packed brown sugar",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 cup peanut butter",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","2 large eggs eggs",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","2 tablespoons water",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","2 .5 cups sifted all-purpose flour",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 teaspoon baking soda",
"Melt In Your Mouth Peanut Butter Cookies","1 teaspoon salt",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Beat the shortening with the sugars and the peanut butter until well mixed. Beat in the egg and the water."
"Step 3","Gradually beat in the flour, baking soda and salt. Form cookies on an ungreased baking sheet with a cookie press or roll into balls and smash flat with a floured fork or fingers."
"Step 4","Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 12 minutes or more until done, usually when the puffed up cookie has lowered down to level. Before then it is more chewy."
"Step 5","For High Altitude, omit water and add eggs last, mixing well, but not beating them as at sea level. Raise the temperature to 390 degrees F (200 degrees C). Or use a convection oven at 312 degrees F (155 degrees C) for 15 min works even better."
"Date Drop Cookies I","1 cup butter",
"Date Drop Cookies I","1 teaspoon salt",
"Date Drop Cookies I","1 teaspoon vanilla extract",
"Date Drop Cookies I","1 .5 cups white sugar",
"Date Drop Cookies I","2 large eggs eggs",
"Date Drop Cookies I","3 .5 cups sifted all-purpose flour",
"Date Drop Cookies I",".75 teaspoon baking soda",
"Date Drop Cookies I","5 tablespoons milk",
"Date Drop Cookies I","2 cups dates, pitted and chopped",
"Date Drop Cookies I",".75 cup chopped walnuts",
"Step 1","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C)."
"Step 2","Combine margarine or butter, salt, and vanilla; blend well. Add sugar and cream well. Beat eggs and blend into mixture."
"Step 3","Sift flour with soda and add to the creamed mixture, alternately with the milk. Mix thoroughly."
"Step 4","Stir in dates and nuts."
"Step 5","Drop from teaspoon and flatten with glass covered with damp cloth. Sprinkle with sugar."
"Step 6","Bake at 350 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes. Cool and enjoy."
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies",".5 cup butter",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies",".33 cup whole milk",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies",".5 cup white sugar",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies",".5 cup brown sugar",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies",".5 cup honey",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies","1 pinch salt",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies","1 cup crunchy peanut butter",
"Peanut Butter and Honey No-Bake Cookies","3 .5 cups instant oatmeal, or more as needed",
"Step 1","Combine the butter, milk, white sugar, brown sugar, and honey in a large pot over medium-high heat; bring to a rapid boil for 90 seconds. Stir the salt and peanut butter into the mixture and remove immediately from the heat. Add the oatmeal quickly and mix to combine. Make sure the texture is thick with a little bit of sauce, but not too much sauce. If needed add extra oatmeal."
"Step 2","Drop rounded spoonfuls of the dough 2 inches apart onto aluminum foil or waxed paper; allow to sit 1 to 2 hours before serving."
"Martha Washington Cookies","2 large egg whites egg whites",
"Martha Washington Cookies",".25 teaspoon salt",
"Martha Washington Cookies",".688 cup packed brown sugar",
"Martha Washington Cookies","1 .5 teaspoons vanilla extract",
